utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Previously on House.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't know how I got here. I saw a symptom before the crash.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Why was I taking the bus?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Medical hypnosis can...

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: ... bring the brain to a class two theta state.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Taxing an already injured brain.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Someone is dying because I can't remember.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: It was Amber.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She was on the bus with me. She's the one who's dying.

utterance.speaker: ATTENDING DOCTOR
utterance.content: Her heart won't stop racing. No idea what's causing it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Sure it wasn't the bus that landed on her?

utterance.speaker: ATTENDING DOCTOR
utterance.content: It's not trauma. She was stable post-op. This didn't start until an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Delayed reaction to the trauma. She lost both her kidneys in the bus crash. She ripped up her femoral artery.

utterance.speaker: ATTENDING DOCTOR
utterance.content: We fixed the artery, got her on dialysis for the kidneys. Whatever's doing this to her heart, it isn't from the crash.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Check her potassium?

utterance.speaker: ATTENDING DOCTOR
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Why didn't you call me?

utterance.speaker: ATTENDING DOCTOR
utterance.content: She's been under the whole time. She had no ID.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Pushed adenosine?

utterance.speaker: ATTENDING DOCTOR
utterance.content: And verapamil, and floated the swan an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Coronary angiography?

utterance.speaker: ATTENDING DOCTOR
utterance.content: Three critical patients ahead of her. We'll have her in within the hour.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: We're fifteen minutes away from Princeton Plainsboro by ambulance.

utterance.speaker: ATTENDING DOCTOR
utterance.content: You wanna move her? Her heart rate is a hundred and thirty.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She's hemodynamically stable. We're moving her.

utterance.speaker: ATTENDING DOCTOR
utterance.content: You're not her doctor. You can't make that decision.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Her husband can.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Right?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Move her.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If the trauma didn't damage her heart...

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Why was she on the bus?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't know. If she had any underlying condition, the accident could have exacerbated it.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Why were you with her?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't know! I'm not hiding anything. I just don't remember. What else could damage her heart?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Wilson, don't get lost! I'm barely coherent. I need your help right now.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: V-fib!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Charging.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Okay. Okay.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait! Protective hypothermia.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You wanna freeze her? Her heart's not beating.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Her heart's already damaged. If you restart it, it'll keep racing, shoot off free radicals, and kill her brain. We ice her down, put her on bypass until you've diagnosed her.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: This is not a solution. All you're doing is pressing pause.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: It gives you more time to find a diagnosis. House, this is Amber!

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Cold saline solution.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Cool temperature down to ninety.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Bypass circulating.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: She's stable.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Why are we doing this?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Bought us time to think.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The trauma must have stimulated a pre-existing heart condition.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Autoimmune congenital anomaly, blood clotting disorder, lead poisoning...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Great! Let's explore that. Quick, get her on panacea.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: We can narrow it down by looking for arterial blockages.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: How? On an echo? Can't see wall motion when there's no motion.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: EKG, nope. Heart's in the off position. Thallium uptake scan? Useless on a cold heart.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, we get it. Her heart's not beating. It's gonna make it harder to diagnose. On the other hand, she's not gonna die while you're whining about it. What else?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: There is another way to narrow it down. If you really did see a symptom in Amber before the crash, physostigmine helped your memory last time.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Why not cyanide? He's a mess. He needs to sleep.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I had a heart attack this morning. Can't do any more drugs till lunch. Get her an angiogram. Could show damage even in a stopped heart. Rest of you search her apartment. Toxins, heavy metals, drugs, anything that might make her heart race.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I need to know if there's anything medically relevant that you couldn't share publicly.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Is this a Philanderers Anonymous intervention?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: You were obviously drinking last night. Maybe you took Amber to a bar.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I left here on my motorcycle alone.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: You ended up drunk on a bus together. Maybe you met Amber in the bar.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I was not having an affair with her.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: You can't really say that if you don't remember.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I lost four hours, not four months.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Maybe it was the first time.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: If you drank together, any chance you did any drugs?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I'll run a tox screen.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: You comin'?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Correspondence, letters to patients, she could have caught something from one of them.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Travel. Do you know if she's been out of the country recently?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: It's just video clips. Maybe she narrates where they are.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: And... action.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Looks like she didn't travel very far.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You look beautiful.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: You look nervous.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I've never done this before.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I have. Trust me. You'll love it.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: As long as we don't know what's wrong, we don't know what's relevant.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: I'm gonna search her bathroom.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Can't really say "yes" when it's a hallucination asking.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Don't worry, you're just dreaming.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: What symptom did I see in you? A myoclonic jerk...

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Boring.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: An incredibly rare neurological symptom is boring? Am I in someone else's subconscious?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: What did we do last night?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Was I meeting you for a drink?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Is that all it was? A man thinks a woman is beautiful, admires her intelligence, admires the way she has to get whatever she wants, the things he likes about himself.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Maybe she always had a little thing for him. His mind. His blue eyes. But someone gets between them. So, they decide to meet one night at an out-of-the-way little bar. Does that sound familiar?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Do I feel familiar? What do you feel? Electricity.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Electricity.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I know I saw the symptom. I know the memory's locked in my brain. Now I know how to get it.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You don't even know what I'm talking about.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You need to rest. I have yet to hear about any study linking electricity and rest.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Deep brain stimulation. It's been proven. Electrical impulses applied directly to the hypothalamus could evoke detailed memories.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: My mistake, drilling a hole and shooting lightning bolts into an already-cracked skull is very restful, it's not fatal at all.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: She's right. You need to sleep.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Brain activity spiked.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Amber. Amber. It's me.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Random spikes are common.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: It's gonna be okay. I'm here with you.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The team has found something. Can you ask her if we can be excused?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Coronary angio was negative.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: So was the tox screen.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: That's what you found? Negative tests? I could have told you she doesn't do drugs.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: We found these in her apartment. Sorry. Prescription diet pills. SSRIs, amphetamines.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Diet pills cause structural damage to the mitral valve, could explain the tachycardia.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Sh-she'd have to be an addict to take enough for it to damage her heart. I'd know.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Did you know that she was hiding them in her vitamins?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: We have to warm her back up. Get her heart beating so we can do a CT to confirm.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: No, we've been over this. Starting her heart could cause brain damage, could burn out the heart muscle.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Test her heart without starting it. Crack her chest open, reach a finger inside the pulmonary vein, run it across the valve.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: That's the safer course?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: It is if we're wrong.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: When did we start assuming we're wrong?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: If this were any other patient...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If the valve is calcified, that's our answer. That's our cure. Go.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: "Thirteen". Who found the diet pills?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You didn't even go in the bathroom, did you? You're suddenly mute in the differentials. A blow-up doll would be more useful. And yes, that's the first time I've ever implied something negative about a blow-up doll.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Normally, I'd be fascinated. Today, don't care. Get over whatever it is and do your job.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Wait. Look at her eye.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: She's jaundiced.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Her liver's not working.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Diet pills don't kill the liver.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Put her back in ICU.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Liver failure means whatever this thing is, it's spreading, despite the fact that she's frozen.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: We can stick a needle in her liver. If we see fibrosis, she's right.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Does Amber drink sherry?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: And the cardio fits just as well. But there's no way we can tell, since we can't take her temperature.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I had a dream. She was pouring me a glass. And since I'm a scotch-, beer-, gin-, and rum-man...

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: If we warm her back up, we should be able to tell if she's got an infection.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Yes, we can get a diagnosis by letting the disease run rampant until it kills her. If it's spreading, we need to slow this even more. We've gotta cool her down further.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I know you love her and, uh, you're scared she's gonna die. But just making her colder and colder isn't a cure. It's not dealing with the reality.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Sherry means something.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Amber doesn't even drink sherry. House. Can we get back...?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If she did drink sherry, it would mean nothing. Since she doesn't, my subconscious is obviously trying to make some other point.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: There's a Sharrie's Bar on Third right off the bus route.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Wilson's right. We need to make her colder.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Putting more ice on her is just delaying the diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Not on, in. Fill in her lungs with slurry.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Taking Wilson out for a drink.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Is this the place?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Maybe.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: I assume you are here...

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: ... for these.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Did you see me here with a-a tall blonde woman?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Yeah, I think she joined you after scotch number seven.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Did she seem sick?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: She sneezed. I gave her a napkin.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Did you see the color of the sputum?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: I assume sputum means snot. Look, I see a lot of drunk chicks in here. I didn't have time to stop and analyze the color of your girlfriend's boogers.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She's not my girlfriend, genius.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: She was hot, you seemed into her, and she bought you drinks.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Last night, she was your girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Blood in the sputum could mean parasites. Any recent travel?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You seemed into her?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If he had a brain, he wouldn't be tending bar.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Sneezing's a new symptom. Let's assume the runny nose means an infection.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: What did House have to say?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Ooh. Not that one. The slurry tube.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: I know this is different. But it's not. Everyone dies.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: You're reacting this way because she might be... soon.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: I'm an Indian guy named "Kutner". Ever wonder what happened to my parents?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: I was six years old. I used to like helping out in my parents' store after school. Guy walks in to rob the place. Ends up shooting them both. Wasn't fair. Took years, but I had to accept that's just the way it was. So you gonna help me fill her lungs up or not?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Tell me that the liver biopsy showed infiltrates, minor inflammation.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Yeah. How...?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Snot on a napkin. Add the heart, infiltrates...

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Hep B.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Start her on IV interferon. I'll go tell Wilson.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Good idea. And I'll go nap because I was concussed last night and had a heart attack this morning. I'll tell Wilson, you go sleep.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Hepatitis B is a lame diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, God. I get less rest when I'm asleep.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I rise from the dead, and that's the reaction I get?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm sorry. If I had known, I would have started a breakaway Jewish sect. Hep B fits.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Why are you doing that?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Because Hep B doesn't fit.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Turn her over.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: We're about to start a second course of interferon.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Which she might not need once you turn her over. Small of her back.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: She's bruised. Why is that significant?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Look closer.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: A rash. How'd you know what was on the small of her back?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Either I'm still asleep, or I'm starting to remember.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Looks like an influenza rash.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: The flu wouldn't be killing her organs one by one.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Dermatomyositis.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Wouldn't speed up her heart.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes, the symptom that I saw on the bus was a rare interferon allergy that flares up two days before you take it.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: How did you see the rash down there?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't know. Maybe she leaned over.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Maybe it's not a rash at all. It could be an abscess.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: "Thirteen", stick a needle in there. If there's pus, Foreman's right.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not asking you to stick a needle all the way through. Taub, you do it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No, apparently, you can't!

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: It's not fluctuant.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Clear. It's not pus.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Means it's vesicular. Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: We had dinner with a friend last week. We walked their dogs. I guess she could've gotten a tick.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's treatable. Doxycycline.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Allow eight hours for the antibiotics to take effect, then we warm her up, shock her heart.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Wait a minute, wait a minute! If we're wrong, restarting her heart could kill her. Run blood cultures first.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: The fastest way to test is to treat. If we're wrong, still should give us time to try something else.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: We are not starting her heart until we're one hundred percent certain.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: We're never one hundred percent certain.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Run the blood cultures. After we get confirmation, then we'll restart her heart.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's wrong. And you know he's wrong. You can't change your mind just because a family member starts crying. They're always scared.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I said, run the blood cultures.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Sorry. Wide stance.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Why are you screwing up?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Did you hate her?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: 'S not guilt. That just leaves fear. Young woman dying. Young doctor dying, in fact. That sound familiar?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: By not getting tested? Dealing with it by not dealing with it. It's clearly working beautifully.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: My grandson gave me a mug that says that. Okay. Enough hand-holding. Deal with it. Get back in there. Or pack up your stuff.

utterance.speaker: CUE MUSIC
utterance.content: "Teardrop" — Jose Gonzalez

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: House is gonna kill the patient.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: What are you... what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: She's up to eighty degrees!

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: We're gonna restart her heart.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: No, you're not! There's still time to undo this, cool her back down.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: You weren't taking the safe approach.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: We've gotta know if the antibiotics are working.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Her EEG's slowed.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Amber. Amber.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Well done. We still don't know what it is, but you just let it spread to her brain!

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: This is exactly what I said would happen! It's in her brain now!

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Brain involvement gives us a new symptom.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: That wouldn't be there if you hadn't...

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: It's where the disease was going. We needed to know that.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: This was not your decision to make! You went behind my back. You went behind House's back.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Inside voices.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: House wanted to warm her up. You just guilted him into changing his mind.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Heart, liver, rash, and now her brain.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Autoimmune fits best. Crash trauma could've set it off. Start her on prednisone, then we'll warm her up again.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: House, if this is some other infection, the steroids will trash her immune system.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: He's the attending. You're the family. Go spend more time with the patient.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You can't do this.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: That's not a good argument. It's not an argument at all. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Cuddy's right. I was afraid to do anything. I thought if everything just stopped, it would be okay.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: And it's gonna be. Taub's starting the treatment. We're doing everything...

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Not everything. Before you warm her up... You said you wanted to try deep brain stimulation.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: But there's no reason. We know the symptom, we know what I saw.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: What if it's not the rash? What if you noticed the rash in the ambulance or when we were putting her on bypass? What if there is still something else stuck inside your head?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You think I should risk my life to save Amber's.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Inserting the IPG probe into your ventral hypothalamus. Give me three volts.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Can't hear him.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Can't hear who?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Everything's in black and white.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Who was talking? Is Amber there?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You're supposed to be jolting my hypothalamus, not petting it.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: We don't want to overload it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: As long as I'm risking my life, I might as well be watching a talkie.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Increasing from three to five volts. Sending impulse.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: You're not getting them back.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey! You take my keys, you gotta give me a phone call.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Who are you calling?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Dial-A-Wilson.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I was on call.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Amber was home.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I told her to find you. Have you pick me up.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I said to find Wilson.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: He's working. And I'm willing to suffer this indignity on his behalf.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Does she seem sick?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: C'mon. Time to go.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Whoa. Need another round! And a drink for... what passes for a lady around here? What's your poison?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Nothing. We're leaving.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: We're leaving, leaving, leaving, leaving... Cosmos. I remember Wilson buying cranberry juice. I'll have another. And she'll have a Cosmopolitan.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: The obstinate drunk thing is not flattering. C'mon. You called for a ride.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Drink your drink, or I'll drink 'em both.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: One. And you leave voluntarily.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Let's go.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey! We need another Cosmo here.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She sneezed.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: What color is it?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Looks like snot. Seems like a cold.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Nothing else?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Think I paid?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: House, what are you doing? You can barely walk.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Go home. I'll take the bus.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Hey, someone's gotta pay for this.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: You forgot something.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You don't give up, do you?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm an idiot that way.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You doing this for me or for Wilson?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: For Wilson.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, then it's even more impressive. Salut.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Ugh, damn, do you have a Kleenex?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I got a sleeve. I got two, actually.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I need more than that. I'm getting that nasty flu.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Is that it? The flu? Is there any rare complication?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No. It would explain the rash, but nothing else. Unless...

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't do it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: It wasn't the flu. It's what she did for it. She has amantadine poisoning.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: The crash destroyed her kidneys. Her body couldn't filter the drugs. She ODs on amantadine. Explains the heart, the liver. We just need to start her on dialysis and flush the drugs out.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: What? What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Amantadine binds with proteins. Dialysis can't clear it out of the blood.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: There's nothing we can do.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Amber.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Amber.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Seizing. Wilson, I need help here!

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: House suffered a complex partial seizure. The violent shaking widened his skull fracture, causing a brain bleed.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: We won't know if there's any cognitive impairment until he's out of the coma.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: He was right about the amantadine. Amber's body couldn't filter it out. That's what caused her heart to beat too fast for too long.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: It caused irreparable structural damage. Didn't matter if they shocked her or froze her.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Her heart was dead once it stopped in that ambulance.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: What about a new heart? Transplant?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: All of her organs are damaged. She can't qualify.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: There's nothing we can do. Nothing we could have done.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: We should call time of death.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Technically, she's still alive. Could probably survive a few more hours on bypass. We could wean her off anesthesia, wake her up, give you a chance to...

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: It would be cruel. Don't...

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Wake Amber up. See her again. Tell her what she means to you.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Wake her up to tell her that she's... that she's...

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You are waking her up so that you can both say good-bye to each other. She would want it.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You're in the hospital.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I'm on bypass.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Yeah. Do you remember what happened?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Got on the bus.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I shouldn't have gotten on the bus.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: No. No, it's not your fault. It's not your fault.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: How bad?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You had tachycardia. It's complicated by complete renal failure. The tachycardia degenerated into V-fib... followed by hepatic failure.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: The flu pills?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I'm dead.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I love you too.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: She didn't even like us.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: We liked her.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Did we?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: We do now.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: What do we say?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: We don't need to say anything.

utterance.speaker: CUE MUSIC
utterance.content: "Re: Stacks" — Bon Iver

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I'm tired.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I think it's time to go to sleep.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Just a little longer.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: We are always gonna want just a little longer.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I don't think I can do it.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: It's okay.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: It's not okay. Why is it okay with you? Why aren't you angry?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: That's... not... the last feeling I want to experience.

utterance.speaker: CUE MUSIC
utterance.content: "Light for the Deadvine" - People in Planes

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I think he's stable.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Still non-responsive.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You're dead.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Everybody dies.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Am I dead?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Should be.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Because life shouldn't be random. Because lonely, misanthropic drug addicts should die in bus crashes, and young do-gooders in love, who get dragged out of their apartment in the middle of the night, should walk away clean.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Self-pity isn't like you.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No, well, I'm branching out from self-loathing and self-destruction. Wilson is gonna hate me.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: You kind of deserve it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: He's my best friend.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: What now?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I could stay here with you.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Get off the bus.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I can't.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Because... because it doesn't hurt here. I let it... I don't wanna be in pain. I don't wanna be miserable. And I don't want him to hate me.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Well, you can't always get what you want.

utterance.speaker: CUE MUSIC
utterance.content: "Passing Afternoon" - Iron and Wine

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Hey, I'm here. Blink if you can hear me.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: No, shh, don't try to talk. Just rest.
